intro: Thottea triserialis, commonly known as the three-row lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has strap-like, grassy leaves arranged in three rows along its stem. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, erect stem that supports its showy inflorescence. Thottea triserialis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
